item.title: Auto yell help
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

if(messagetimer == 180) { messagetimer = 0; int random = misc.random(4); if (random == 0) PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("Mods and admins will have crowns by their names. So don't get fooled!"); if (random == 1) PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("random message 2"); if (random == 2) PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("random message 3"); if (random == 3) PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("random message 4"); if (random == 4) PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("random message 5"); }
easy

item.title: Auto yell help
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

Too many posts for such a simple solution. Just change it to:

[code]do {
++messagetimer;
} while(messagetimer < 180);

if(messagetimer == 180) {
messagetimer = 0;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (“Mods and admins will have crowns by their names. So don’t get fooled!”);
}[/code]

Note: the message will be sent once at startup because it’s a do-while loop; change it to a plain while loop if you wish.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto yell help
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

Hi everyone I just need a little bit of help with this code.

My server is a 317
it is a sendMessage

Alright, I installed this auto yell thing, I get no compiling errors, but the code just doesn’t seem to want to work. Either the timing is wayyy to long or it just… doesn’t work lol.

Well anyway I have this in my client.java

    public int messagetimer = 0;

and this:

[code]if (messagetimer > 0) {
messagetimer += 1;
}

            if (messagetimer == 180) {
                    messagetimer = 0;
                    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("Mods and admins will have crowns by their names.  So don't get fooled!");
            }[/code]

Anyone see anything wrong?

Also if I get it to work, can someone tell me to add more than one message that it will yell?

Thanks :rolleyes:

Read full topic
